intro: Cynanchum hatusimae, commonly known as the Japanese milkvetch, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Japan. It belongs to the family Asclepiadaceae and is characterized by its slender stems and small, greenish-white flowers. The plant produces a milky sap, which is a distinguishing feature of the genus Cynanchum. It typically grows in shaded, moist environments such as forests and mountainous regions. Due to its ornamental value and medicinal properties, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens and traditional herbal practices.
